SkillDescriptions.Title: Assassination
SkillDescriptions.Description: Deals <physical>{maindamagerate}% (of output capacity) physical</physical> and <caster>{casterdamagerate}% (of output capacity) caster's elemental</caster> damage to an enemy with least health points.

SkillDescriptions.Title: Deadly Blade
SkillDescriptions.Description: Deals <poison>{maindamagerate}% (of output capacity) poison</poison> and <caster>{casterdamagerate}% (of output capacity) caster's elemental</caster> to an enemy with highest health points.

SkillDescriptions.Title: Strike

QuestDescriptions.Title: {monsterslot} {monstertype} hunt request.
QuestDescriptions.Description: My lord, {monsterslot} {monstertype} is posing threats to our town's safety. We better strike them down before they cause more troubles!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Supply Shortage
QuestDescriptions.Description: My lord, it seems that there have been an empire wide shortage of supplies! We may take advantage of this trend!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Prologue
QuestDescriptions.Description:
In order to survive in this chaotic empire, we need to be able to conduct explorations！
 Explorations will bring valuable resources for our town!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Collector
QuestDescriptions.Description: If we want to expand our town and attract more residents, it is crucial to have a strong economy. Resources collected during explorations can be used to produce equipment, which can be used to equip our adventure team or sold for profit!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Path to Adventure
QuestDescriptions.Description:
The Inn has always been a great place to meet up with different adventurers, and some may be interested in applying for permanent jobs in our small town!
 If you find yourself short of gold, we can always go to Adventurer Panel to sell unused equipment.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Finance Management
QuestDescriptions.Description: Products from all over the empire are sold in the shop. It can be quite helpful if we stock up on battle supplies!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Town Management
QuestDescriptions.Description:
Residents can make great contributions to our town.
 Let's add some new residents! My lord, you may attract more resident applications by completing adventures.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Orc Threats
QuestDescriptions.Description: Orcs from Wooden Forest are of great danger to our town! Since we have established a strong adventure team now, we may be able to defeat them once and for all!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Blood Stone
QuestDescriptions.Description: Slaying orcs may have drawn attentions from blood stone beast lives deep in the woods.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Red Bird
QuestDescriptions.Description: Our Crown Prince was kidnapped by a bird monster! Rumor says such monster was last spotted in Mist Forest!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Evil Spirit
QuestDescriptions.Description: Investigate Mist Forest.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Furnace
QuestDescriptions.Description: A permit for furnace? Interesting... Let's build one, my lord!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Bone Demon
QuestDescriptions.Description: Scouts of the Dragon Court have noted unusual movements around Buried Temple of the Deity Dragon. Since we cannot find much clues about Crown Prince in Snow Mountain, we may move on to Buried Temple for investigation.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Blood Eyes
QuestDescriptions.Description: Investigate Buried Temple.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Demon Dragon 1
QuestDescriptions.Description: Demon Dragon manifests powers from peoples’ worships of The Deity Dragon. It transforms the very sacred image of The Deity Dragon into sin and slavery, attempts to manipulate peoples’ mind for its own evil deeds. My lord, the whole empire is furious and we really need to revenge for our emperor!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Demon Dragon 2
QuestDescriptions.Description: Demon Dragon manifests powers from peoples’ worships of The Deity Dragon. It transforms the very sacred image of The Deity Dragon into sin and slavery, attempts to manipulate peoples’ mind for its own evil deeds. My lord, the whole empire is furious and we really need to revenge for our emperor!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Snow Mountain
QuestDescriptions.Description: There are so many worms in this Snow Mountain...

QuestDescriptions.Title: God of Death
QuestDescriptions.Description: Investigate Snow Mountain

QuestDescriptions.Title: Tactics!
QuestDescriptions.Description: Enable some powerful tactics for our adventurers!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Hundred Battle
QuestDescriptions.Description: Demons spread out of the Twisted Time are deadly and powerful! Slay them!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Practice
QuestDescriptions.Description: Let's try out these tactics!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Challenge
QuestDescriptions.Description: We have received a letter of challenge for our adventurers. Would you like to respond?

QuestDescriptions.Title: Study, study!
QuestDescriptions.Description: The sea of knowledge is endless, and diligence is our only boat for surviving...

QuestDescriptions.Title: Shadows in the Wood
QuestDescriptions.Description: Smells of corruptions come out of the Wooden Forest...

QuestDescriptions.Title: Crystal Stone
QuestDescriptions.Description: My lord, if you can send a team of adventurers to help recover my heirloom, I may be able to utilize it to improve our weapon quality.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Gear Upgrade
QuestDescriptions.Description: Furnace is a good way to recycle unused items. Combine items of the same type and quality, can produce a new item of higher quality.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Mystic
QuestDescriptions.Description: There is a mystic stone found in shadow pathway may be powerful enough to lift the seal. If we can acquire such stone, the full potential of our school may be realized!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Dragon Blood
QuestDescriptions.Description: My lord, in order to further upgrade our furnace, I think it is time to find Dragon Blood Stone from Snow Mountain.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Demon Dragon 3
QuestDescriptions.Description: Slay the Demon Dragon!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Farming, farming, farming!
QuestDescriptions.Description: Grinding can be such a delight!

QuestDescriptions.Title: A Charming Flame
QuestDescriptions.Description: This pile of ashes look so familiar….

QuestDescriptions.Title: Hidden Cult
QuestDescriptions.Description: Our Hidden Wood has been fully developed and is exposing dramatic powers. However, there are unsettling mists slowly leaking out of it… as if it is some kind of vessel.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Immortal Corpse, Shijie Xian
QuestDescriptions.Description: Black bead is releasing dark powers, as if it is summoning something!

QuestDescriptions.Title: The heartless unicorn, Qilin
QuestDescriptions.Description: Candlelight flickered, and mysterious scents developed. My lord, there are devilish lights radiating from Wooden Forest, shall we go and take a look?

QuestDescriptions.Title: The soulless unicorn, Qilin
QuestDescriptions.Description: Wind from the Mist Forest is biting my bone! And I could almost hear a woman singing…

QuestDescriptions.Title: The sinless unicorn, Qilin
QuestDescriptions.Description: These unsettling nightmares strikes me every night! They seem to hint a powerful source hiding in the Buried Temple…

QuestDescriptions.Title: The undead aristocracy
QuestDescriptions.Description: Explore Nether Palace.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Exploration!
QuestDescriptions.Description: My lord, since now we have earned trusts from the Dragon Court, it is time for us to setup our own exploration teams. With exploration teams available, we will be able to conduct multiple treasure hunts at the same time and serve the Dragon Court more efficiently!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Evil Books
QuestDescriptions.Description: My lord, the Dragon Court has requested us to kill royal librarian Zhuolun. It is believed that he edited Demon Dragon’s lies and made them available to public by spreading them all over the archived books!

QuestDescriptions.Title: Remnants
QuestDescriptions.Description: Your endless killing has summoned old evil spirits back into life form…

QuestDescriptions.Title: Thugs
QuestDescriptions.Description: Many rebels have gathered around at the Northern Territory and even invaded the State Office. It is only a matter of time for them to eventually spread into nearby states. Since they specifically targeted us, let us send our adventurers over to show our strengths. This may as well return a good favor for the Dragon Court.

QuestDescriptions.Title: Nameless Rebels
QuestDescriptions.Description: Investigate further into Northern Territory...

QuestDescriptions.Title: Heresy: {dungeontype}
Heretic Demon Dragon：{dungeontype}

DialogDetails.Dialog: My lord, our empire is infested with monsters, and the emperor is deeply concerned.  All neighboring towns have devoted every resource possible, recruiting adventurers and hunting invaders, hoping to attract His Majesty’s attention. As a poor town with scarce supplies, this monster hunting movement may be our only chance for survival, if we can really meet His Majesty’s requests.

The Wooden Forest outside of town has long been occupied by orcs. In these past few months, these orcs have been causing quite some trouble for our residents. They steal foods, kill little animals, harm children, stare at pretty ladies [insert other generic bad deeds here] … you know, all those bad things bad creatures just can’t stop doing. I would suggest our adventurers explore that area.
What an encouraging surprise! Our weapon shop and armor shop haven’t been opened for business for ages. With these materials, we finally can craft powerful equipment for our adventurers!

Additionally, we have also acquired ‘practice points’ during our exploration. Adventurers can be leveled up by spending ‘practice points’. Every 5 levels, adventurer is rewarded with 1 talent point that can be used to further advance adventurer's battle ability. During battles, ‘rage points’ can be slowly accumulated, and can then be used to release powerful tactics! My lord, I would suggest you to have a look at these powerful tactics!

My lord! While reading stars and practicing some divination last night, I managed to find this … emm… colorful piece of blueprint … under the table… Look, how shiny hah? I believe it is an inn blueprint for sure. With an inn, we can recruit more adventurers! Exciting isn’t it?

There are so many interesting and powerful adventurers in the world. If we keep an eye on our little inn, we may be able to find some epic adventurers to support our exploration and monster hunt! I’m pretty sure I’ve seen one guy the other day…Ohh man… This guy could eat 10 giant bowls of noodles in ONE seating under 30 minutes! Can you believe it? ONE SEATING! HOLY ****. My lord, why are you staring at me like that? Oops, my lines right… If we can manage to assemble a group of powerful adventurers, we will win trust from the Dragon Court in no time!
Good news my lord! When you were busy building that small inn, I managed to steal… borrow this shiny piece of blueprint … from our neighbor town! I am pretty sure it is a blueprint for ‘Shop’.
With shop, our small town will be able purchase rare goods from other parts of the empire. These goods ranging from adventuring supplies to powerful equipment.

Unfortunately, trade routes can experience quite some delays due to monster invasions, and the shop catalogue can only be updated rather slowly. However, my lord, our shop workers can follow adventurers to speed up trades upon successful adventures. In other words, more successful adventures mean more frequent shop catalogue updates! And the more challenging the adventures are, the better products we can stock up!

My lord, our small town is growing! With solid trade routes and a strong adventure team, it is time to expand our resident base! Residents can make dramatic contributions for town development, they may increase trade prices, enhance item productions, level up building facilities and attract better adventure loots. Some rare residents may contribute mystic resources! Every successful adventure will attract some resident applications, and my lord may grant occupancy for one of them.
Please be noted however, my lord, our town may only provide hospitality for a limited number of residents.

It is also logical to occasionally dispel residents when their contributions are no longer needed for the town… This may seem cruel, but these measures are inevitable if we want to make the town more prosperous and strong.
My lord, our scout has located Purple Skin orc in Wooden Forest. It is time for us to fight back!
Purple Skin is quite a brutal creature, be prepared my lord!
My lord! Bad news from the Dragon Court! Our Crown Prince was kidnaped by a bird monster! Rumor has it the monster was last spotted in Mist Forest!
All major lords around the empire have dispatched their best adventurer teams to investigate Crown Prince’s case. We need to be hurry!

My lord! Old priest left town last night, and still has not come back. So, it is me to deliver messages from the emperor. His Majesty has decreed all lords to slay Demon Dragon in Hellish Path, as His Majesty believes that our Crown Prince has already been killed by this Demon Dragon… my lord, such tragedy shall not be tolerated!

Demon dragon manifests powers from peoples’ worships of The Deity Dragon. It transforms the very sacred image of The Deity Dragon into sin and slavery, attempts to manipulate peoples’ mind for its own evil deeds. My lord, the whole empire is furious, and we really need to revenge for our emperor!
Emmm…. What a lovely day……
Finally, our lord is ready for some explorations! I’m so ready to kick some ugly monsters’ stinky asses!

I was walking around on the street the other day, and met this muscular man. He claimed that he has this ‘tactic’ ability, and then when he showed me it was IMPRESSIVE! Not sure whether it’s the man or the ‘tactic’… I’m so confused!
After so many years… people starts to talk about Prince Lu’s rebellion again… ohhh…. Such tragedy should never happen again…
Wah! Haven’t seen weapon shop and armor shop open for business forever! The whole town was dead without them.
We are building up our own adventure team? Great news! Killing monsters and hunt loots are sooooooo fun! Ohh, of course, protect our homeland too ……. Whatever what that ‘homeland’ thing means…
Orcs should be easy to kill, I just happen to know this.

Ever since Prince Lu’s rebellion, most of the empire’s towns have stopped making weapons in fear of the Dragon Court’s suspicion… Is this really a good sign? Under the name of protecting the Dragon Court and the emperor, we are making weapons again…
How shiny and pretty are those beautiful gems! Embed them on my strong armors, and hang them over my bed… sleep with them every day…how romantic!
Blacksmith can finally return my money! Hahahahaha !
Tactics with aura? What more can you ever ask for!
I’m so excited about these powerful weapons and tactics! Bravo to my lord!
Hopefully my lord may allow me tactic ability! I won’t be a disappointment!
Chatting with heroes over wines, can be really inspiring!
I would love to share lore with travelling adventurers in our lovely inn!
Is our inn a good place for blind date?
I have heard people talking about ‘ancient heroes’, and they seem to be equipped with extreme power and attributes. How great if we can recruit some for our town!
Even for adventurers of the same class, their strengths may vary dramatically among each other.
It can be a sad moment letting go an adventurer when he or she is no longer needed for our service. It is still worth noting that we may recover practice points from these left adventurers.
In order to build an elite adventure team, we will have to only keep the best attributed talents and let go the weak ones.
Shop is open!? I’m soooo in a shopping mood right now!
We can sell weapons now! I have heard that some residents with business talents can greatly lift our bargain position during sales, and may significantly increase our income! Worth a try doesn’t it?
Accessories, accessories! I want to get some powerful accessories!
It can be beneficial if we bring some life potions or magic bread for adventures, heals can be saver especially in dangerous conditions!
Sale! Sale! Sale! Let’s sale everything and make a fortune!
Hum…hum… (puff hard) … food delivery from nearby town?
That’s really a funny way to beg for mercy, big orc.
Hum… to eat or not to eat, that’s the question … as food, you are mandated to be eaten…
Strangers… are you the ones who invaded my forest, destroyed my clan and killed my brother?
Yes, we are only here to negotiate after your invasions into our town in the first place. Hoping to reach peace with your kind.

Peace? Who invaded whom? Our clan has lived in Wooden Forest for centuries. Even when the Deity Dragon offered the Great Book to your emperor, He also drew clear boundaries for our land. ;In the past decades, your people, who claimed to be citizen of the Heaven Dynasty and protectors of the Deity Dragon, have never stopped invading our land. And our revenge is now considered ‘invasion’? How innocent!
Clever defense. However, the Deity Dragon granted your survival out of mercy. It is not a justification for your kind’s existence! And playing the victim only shows your cunning nature. Pathetic!
Hum…. Your Heaven Dynasty has long betrayed heaven, and your attitude is no surprise to us. Just remember, karma always plays its role, masterfully.
This creatures' clothes look very much like that of the old Dragon Court servants'!
Goo…goo… have they seen through my illusion trick?
You are one of those excommunicated old Dragon Court servants! How dare you serve the dark forces, and kidnap our Crown Prince!?
What Crown Prince? We have left the court for years, and have never seen any prince…

What a lie! When your people participated in Prince Lu's rebellion, your intention of sabotaging the Emperor was clear... His Majesty was just too merciful to kill you all. ;And now you hide in Mist Forest, practicing occult magic, and posing a danger to nearby civilians! It is hard to not link you with the Crown Prince's kidnapping.

Practicing your so-called occult magic, is our only way to maintain our lives! Being excommunicated from the Dragon Court wasn't out of mercy, but hatred, because as servants of the Dragon Court we could not live without the Emperor's blessing.;Whether we were betrayers or loyalists, it is not something to be decided by someone like you. Let’s just fight, since you already have your answer to your question.
Dirty liar!
Your righteous will not last long!
My lord, we have received a letter of challenged for our adventurers. Would you like to correspond?
At such a troubled time for the empire, your Lord keeps recruiting troops and researching forbidden skills. It all seems so suspicious, don't you guys think?
Our Lord is only trying to protect the empire by following the Emperor's order. Who are you, to be making provocative comments like this?
The Emperor's order...? Did you see him write this order himself?

My lord, your interest in academia has truly touched my heart. However, our school’s potential is still constraint by seals. Asking for permission from the Dragon Court will be impossible, although I have heard there is a mystic stone found in Shadow Pathway may be powerful enough to lift the seal. If we can acquire such stone, the full potential of our school may be realized!

My lord, war with dark forces is not easy. These monsters have all the lies, tricks and shadow magics at their disposal, ready to eliminate us at all cost. We, citizen of Heaven Dynasty, are blessed by the Deity Dragon! We are leaders of the world, and defeating these dark creatures is both your greatest duty and honor! Destroying orcs is a tremendous success! Every resident of our town is celebrating.

However, our success has inevitably drawn attentions from creatures lurking around deep in the woods. There is a creature called ‘Blood Stone Beast’, manifests blood and possesses great power. Scout from our neighbor town has recently spotted this creature in nearby areas, and this can be dangerous. We will need to find and hunt it down before it creates real troubles.
Please be aware my lord, this creature is very dangerous.
Blood…fresh blood…nice…
What a pair of evil eyes…
Blood full of greediness and deception, is the most delicious…
I, practice the purest and most divine method, consume your bone and blood…. I am humble and natural, fearless and formless…
Anger, struggle, screaming, begging … all just dusts…
My lord, I have a small request if you would allow me…

Many years ago, my brother stole away my family heirloom due to some difference of opinions. He insisted on going to the capital and starting a new life there. He disappeared after entering Wooden Forest, and I have never seen him nor received any messages from him ever since… A few days ago, I have overheard people in the inn chatting about a crystal looking stone they saw during their adventure. It might be my family heirloom…

My lord, if you can send a team of adventurers helping me recover my heirloom, I may be able to utilize it to improve our weapon quality. That stone may look normal, it is quite an enchanted tool for crafting weapons!
Father… father… is that you?
(Seems to be a talking corpse) father who…?
Father… Is it true… That the capital is flourishing with wealth and prosperity…?
Are you… blacksmith Wong’s big brother?
Father…the crystal stone is here…I… I’m going to take it to the capital… to serve Dragon Court with it… Only their admiration of my great work may save our family…
……you must be blacksmith Wong’s big brother if you have the crystal stone. Do you know your brother has been looking for you all these years?
Brother… brother….hahahahaha! What a joke! He’s not my brother, he is a thief! THIEF!

When the Deity Dragon offered the Great Book to the emperor, He raised a lot of miracles around the world. This crystal stone was one of those miracles… ;Like the Deity Dragon’s Beard, all these relics represent heaven’s mandate, and are considered a danger to the Dragon Court’s unquestionable power! ;They need to be banned… and will cause troubles for our family!

You are insane… it is only a stone, not relic, not mandate of heaven, and certainly not the Deity Dragon’s miracle… you clearly imagined all these… and are intimidated by your own imagination… ;That stone is your family’s heirloom… you need to return it back to your brother and rest in peace…
Father… I really want to see the capital… I want to be one of those talented blacksmiths immortalized with their gifted skills… I am not imagining… I am not…
Thank you very much! My lord! With crystal stone, I am able to make more powerful weapons for our town!

As for my brothers' tragedy... I am deeply sorry to bring you into my families nonsense... My big brother had long been suffering from delusions ever since he was little. When my father was still alive, we visited a lot of doctors for help, but never found a successful treatment. Then my father died, and my brother's symptoms only got worse and worse... It was truly a tragedy... and it is really a relief seeing him rest in peace, now...

What a sorrowful thing, seeing these old Dragon Court servants having their souls so deeply corrupted... It is clear that the Mist Forest is hiding more secrets than we thought. We need to investigate further for leads regarding Crown Prince's kidnapping.
Ohhh my lord… what is this thing!?
Kkaa….kkkaaaa……
What is this smell!! Oh!! It is poisonous!
Kaa…kaakkkaa…
Kaaka….kakakkaaa…. demon… evil… human… dragon…
Kill…Kill!!!!!

Yan, the Skull Collector… is resuscitated!? It is an ancient evil, sustains its life form by consuming bones and souls. In ancient times, it was one of the most ferocious enemies for our ancestors. Its resuscitation is quite an unexpected discovery.
More updates from the Dragon Court, it is believed that Crown Prince has been transferred to Snow Mountain. It is unclear what these monsters are attempting to do.
Great job my lord! Now we have a furnace! With furnace we can combine equipment into higher quality!
My lord, in order to further upgrade our furnace, I think it is time to find Dragon Blood Stone from Snow Mountain.

Yitchin, the Nest of Thousand Worms was one of deadly devil summoned by Prince Lu. It had hidden in Snow Mountain for quite some time, fetching its minion worms killing nearby civilians. Solders attempted defeating it were hardly seen returning back, let alone accomplishing any positive progress. Our success is remarkable.

You, so-called people of the Heaven Dynasty, fighting against heaven’s will, establishing your own imperial power without the Deity Dragon’s permission! How unruly! And now you dare to challenge god…Do you truly know your consequences?

You are no god to us, and your words do not represent heaven’s will. We take orders from the emperor, the son of heaven. His Majesty represents the Deity Dragon’s will. We have never fought against heaven, we only kill evils like you.
Life can be delusional, kids. You are all fascinated by well crafted powers and lies, helping a gambler tampering mandate of heaven for his own good… This is a tragedy.
Ignorance deserves death!
Give up kids! Mandate of heaven may not be defied!
Childish kids… do you know you will never be able to find your fake Crown Prince?

Prince Lu’s rebellion had brought great damage to our empire, it weakened the very foundation of our empire’s order and stability. These creatures, with their lies and delusions, keep manifesting people’s faith and fear, growing stronger and stronger. Dark Executor was once the Death God guiding the dead to peace. Now, he is infested by dark power and becoming an evil himself.

Scouts of the Dragon Court have noted unusual movements around Buried Temple of the Deity Dragon. Since we cannot find much clues about Crown Prince in Snow Mountain, we may move on to Buried Temple for investigation.
Goo…goo…. You guys, look so energetic and silly….
Gooo….so you guys are here for some prince, right?
How did you know?
Goo… as you can see, I’m a god with a lot of eyes…. I see things….
…all right, since you can see things, we can be straight with each other. Did you kidnap Crown Prince, or know where he is now?
Gooo…goo…goooo….I did not kidnap any prince… although, I do know where your Crown Prince is….
Where?
He doesn’t exist in this world… there is no any Crown Prince in your empire.
!!What a cunning creature! Are you playing with us!?
Gooo….. goooo…. I’m not lying guys…. I’ve been very honest with you….
Lier!
You have come this far, trying to betray the Deity Dragon’s will, and tamper mandate of heaven. We, the blessed spirits of the Deity Dragon, shall not allow you to proceed any further!

Spirits or demons? Your protected Demon Dragon, killed our Crown Prince, and now claiming itself to be the Deity Dragon? ;What a cheap and skill-less lie! Monsters like you helped Prince Lu’s rebellion, killing millions of innocent lives! Was that massacre described as a divine deed from your Demon Dragon’s perspective?

It’s your emperor who is good at manufacturing lies and delusions. He wanted to change the mandate of heaven, so he could be the emperor without the Deity Dragon’s blessing. ;His conspiracy eventually succeeded, and the true son of heaven, Prince Lu, was killed as a traitor! ;Millions of people were killed so he could stabilize his regime. Now, he even made up a ‘Crown Prince kidnapping’ incident to manipulate the whole empire even more!
You monsters’ creativity for making lies are just endless.
Believe it or not, you may return back to town and see if some important town members are gone. Their tasks of spreading lie and conspiracies have completed.
Fighting against heaven, only leads to death!
Saviors, may be transformed into manipulators. Manipulators, may be masked as saviors. Between these two, which do you prefer to be?
None of your business.
Violence and insolence, the weak are dominated by fears and may never realize true dangers of their own.
Murdering of our Crown Prince, summoning monsters invading our empire. Demon Dragon, you will die today under my heaven blessed blade!

Heaven’s bless is a law, not some moral righteous. If one is deemed to be dead, heaven’s blessing will keep it in peace. If one is deemed to be alive, heaven’s blessing will keep away any intentions to kill. ;Your Dragon Court, has never stopped stealing away this very power of law. You think you have abandoned the Deity Dragon, but at the same time you also have given up your identity of being the citizen of Heaven Dynasty.

Ever since when the Deity Dragon offered the Great Book to our emperor, it was and is clear that His Majesty represented and will continue to represent heaven’s will. Please stop all your lies and heresies!
Corruption was not started on its own. Evils and demons could not be summoned by themselves. When the whole empire fell into hellish pain and suffer, it is not the cause but the consequence.
Indeed! Prince Lu’s selfish rebellion seeded all these corruptions and summoned all these demons. We are here to defeat these demons, so heaven’s order can be restored!
Prince Lu possessed the Deity Dragon’s Beard. You would understand what that means. He was the Deity Dragon’s selected emperor.
But our emperor was still young and alive! If anyone who holds the Deity Dragon’s beard could just claim himself as the emperor, then what kind of order is that!

The one who holds the Deity Dragon’s Beard, is the one to be the emperor. How is this not considered order? Or are you only considering maintaining complete control over the regime is the only way to keep order. Then where does heaven’s will go? Who may represent heaven’s will… The emperor himself?
I have heard too many of your fake theory! Now I only believe in killing you to be our first step to recover heaven’s will!
Fighting against heaven’s will, only leads to death!
Your love is fire!
My love is fire!
Love is fire!
Flames! Pretty!
Enough！
Fighting against heaven’s will, only leads to death!
Heaven is indifferent, nothing may be tolerated!
Even when the world collapses, I may still stand!
Hey! You won’t be able to hurt me!
Cheer up! My friends!
Have…have we just defeated orcs? Holy *&^%!
Beasts that can talk about ‘mandate of heaven’… how strange…

I know people say our emperor was chosen by the Deity Dragon, and we are citizens of the Heaven Dynasty… but ever since I was little, I have never seen the Deity Dragon, nor any of His relics in my whole life… We have prayed to our ancestors, knelt before our emperor’s majesty… and the Deity Dragon? Very little sacrifices have we ever done…
I was told that, if we manage to slay powerful demons, more adventurers with different professions may come to our town!
If one wants to slay monsters equipped with powerful fire magics, one must be well prepared with fire resistant equipment.
Ever since blacksmith Wong split with his big brother, his family has become rather silent, hardly chatting with others.
I heard blacksmith Wong’s big brother was once a bright and cheerful man, until he started on some cult practices that he learned from foreign counties… he became very sick ever since…
People have been talking about this delusional disorder blacksmith Wong’s big brother has had since little… I just don’t believe it…
Heirloom? I have never heard Wong talked about it before…
Crystal stone that can enhance weapons? That is nice!
Crown Prince being kidnapped by demons? This is something we have never heard of in our empire’s history!
I believe our Crown Prince has not even had his Come-of-Age ceremony yet… how unfortunate…
Demons are outrageous now!!

I suspect there might have been spies involved in the Crown Prince’s kidnapping… the Dragon Court has always been heavily guarded… how was it even possible for the Crown Prince to be kidnapped without any countable witnesses?
I was told that the Mist Forest was heavily influenced by shadow magics… my lord, we will need good shadow resistant equipment before our explorations into the area!
Oh gosh, such a thick book we have recently stocked up. What is this?
‘Farming Guide’… is it some sort of skill book or what?
On its cover, it reads ‘The Ultimate Guide for Farming Reputations and Resources’…
… that’s quite a lame piece of description…
My Lord, there is a cute who said that her sisters would like to read our 'Farming Guide'. They might visit our inn quite a lot...
(Rumbling) hey stranger, are you that silly farming guy?
Whaaaat! A pile of TALKING GRASS!
Ohhh… my mistake, your guys are a different bunch… emmm… but still, why farmers like you, who name themselves as ‘citizens of the Heaven Dynasty’ (rolling eyes), keep farming us?
Farming….?

Yes, farming, like killing us days and nights, to collect some sort of reputations, experience points, and such. The silly farmer before you came here EVERY SINGLE DAY, said he could earn some badges… whatever that thing is.
Why staring at me like that? Your silly fellow friend farmed all my sisters and brothers, and you are here to farm me? LET ME TELL YOU ALL, IM NOT EASILY FARMABLE!
Ohh stop staring at me you $#@! I’m gonna pull your eyes out!
Burn to ashes!
Your race is deluded by your own fabrication!
Burn! To be reborn!
Emm… a pile of ashes? Not sure what it could be used for…
Hey! Flame, flame, flame! Burn burn burn!!
What a strange monster…
Hey! What a strange talking fuel!
……Copycat!
Burn! Burn! Burn you all to death!!
Twenty… twenty… twenty…
(Those bleeding eyes are terrifying!) Excuse me… may I ask what you are counting?

(Insidious smile on face) … I’m counting souls… ;my precious bead only needs one more soul to be fully energized… ;kind strangers, would you mind helping this old lady, by sacrificing your soul to me, so she may be freed from this sinful realm…
Youngsters, if you care your own lives too much, you won’t be able to proceed too far in this unforgiving world!
Twenty…twenty…hahahaha…. yes! Finally!
You…again!? We have already killed you in the Mist Forest! How come….

(Giggles) youngsters… as I have already told you ‘if you care your own lives too much, you won’t be able to proceed too far in this unforgiving world’. I only sacrificed my life, so you guys can help me collecting souls….
What a wicked old lady!
That’s quite an ironic accusation, comes from ‘citizens of the Heaven Dynasty’, who have been quite famous for killing their own fellow citizens….
The cycles of Heaven’s Mandate, executed without conscious of good or evil, shall last until death!
Traitors shall die!
Under tyrant’s regime, evils will be endless!
Heaven's vengeance is slow but sure.
You will eat your own bitter fruit!
Candlelight flickered, and mysterious scents developed. My lord, there are devilish lights radiating from Wooden Forest, shall we go and take a look?

The feet of the Lin, noble sons of our prince. Ah ! they are the Lin! ;Descendants of the Imperial Family, served by people of the Heaven Dynasty, they kill their loved ones with no hesitation. ;Is this your kind of loyalty and love?
Whom are you referring to?
Your so-called traitor Prince Lu, and, of course, your very Emperor.
How dare you!
Wind from the Mist Forest is biting my bone! And I could almost hear a woman singing…

The forehead of the Lin, the noble grandsons of our prince. Ah ! they are the Lin! ;Some people say beautiful women tend to be ill-fated. Others claim that beautiful women are the roots of all corruptions. ;What mortals would not have figured out, is that jokes of fate are quite generous to all. Beautiful souls fade, so do the ugly ones!
These unsettling nightmares strikes me every night! They seem to hint a powerful source hiding in the Buried Temple…
The horn of the Lin, the noble kindred of our prince. Ah ! they are the Lin ! ;Free from this realm isn’t necessarily unfortunate, as living can be suffering.
(!!!What is this…) you are…?
I am the Princess of Lu.
Princess of Lu? Weren’t you killed by His Majesty’s order? (Is this what a princess looks like…?)
I am cursed by ‘Undead Spell’, and death is rather a luxury to me now…
During my short life, I betrayed my husband, my lover, and finally my father. If I could be granted to die, it will be the most fortunate thing!
(Her husband is Prince Lu, and her father is head Prayer of the Dragon Court, then…) Your lover?
His Majesty.
(Laughs) maybe you are not aware the fact that, His Majesty has already been assassinated by me, and now he is also in an ‘undead’ form.
Would you mind doing me a favour? Kill me so I can be released from this realm.; Or, die from trying…

My lord, since now we have earned trusts from the Dragon Court, it is time for us to setup our own exploration teams. With exploration teams available, we will be able to conduct multiple treasure hunts at the same time and serve the Dragon Court more efficiently!

My lord, the Dragon Court has requested us to kill royal librarian Zhuolun. It is believed that he edited Demon Dragon’s lies and made them available to public by spreading them all over the archived books!

My lord! I have a humble request if you would allow me. While the Dragon Court demanded us to kill the old librarian, we can keep his book collections! By doing so, our school’s catalogue will see significant improvement, and that will allow us to advance further into spell specializations! We aren’t officially disobeying His Majesty’s order in any way.

My lord, our recent oversea explorations have encountered some tough robberies. The good news is that we have defeated their latest attempt and captured some of their leaders. They claimed to be people form the Northern Territory, and they received orders from some higher officers to attack our exploration boats.

Many rebels have gathered around at the Northern Territory and even invaded the State Office. It is only a matter of time for them to eventually spread into nearby states. Since they specifically targeted us, let us send our adventurers over to show our strengths. This may as well return a good favor for the Dragon Court.
Hey my brothers! Look at these ‘Dragon Messengers’ coming all the way down here! Trying to save us maybe!?
Heroes! Big heroes! Come here my brothers! Here is a group of heroes for us to worship!
What a massive honour! To be saved by heroes!
Aren’t you tired of being heroes and saving the world every day?
No, for the sake of people, we ought to be heroes without any hesitations.
People? Do you mean people like me? Pardon me for not understanding what you have done for people like me.
We have destroyed demons and kept orders of this world.
What if demons were born due to tyranny leaded by our majesty, and orders are causes of our miseries. Do you still perceive any significances out of your heroic deeds?
Speechless?

I just find it hard to reason with you. Weaknesses in humanity breed demons and evils, and they can come from anyone, emperors or common folks alike. In a world where holders of powers get to do whatever they like, orders are the only protections common folks have. Destroying orders only allows greedy careerists to be more reckless and cruel, and people’s lives can be sacrificed like grass.
Nonsense! We create our own orders and control our own fate!
Distorted the Mandate of Heaven to arrogate all powers, only to get destroyed because he showed how powers can be exploited. Ironic isn’t it?
What role are your assigning yourself to in this little story of yours?
A rather corny one, holder of the Mandate of Heaven.
This world hardly needs more holders for the Mandate of Heaven.
Correct, so we need to destroy the incompetent one.
You think ‘competency’ is the decisive factor for holding the Mandate of Heaven?
Is it not?
If it is, then disqualifying it would have been too easy. In a world full of challenges and trial and errors, ‘competency’ of others are always too easy to judge.

Good excuses. However, in the face of poverty, hunger, wars and slaughters, it will be hard to not blame on ‘competency’. The Mandate of Heaven is choosing a new holder, and ‘competencies’ of all candidates will be challenged, willingly or not.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Strength
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines output capacity for melee classes, current output capacity is {rate}.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Intelligence
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines output capacity for caster classes, current output capacity is {rate}.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Agility
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines battle turn progress speed. When Hit Rate Adjustment and Dodge Rate Adjustment are presented, agility can increase hit/dodge rate as well. Current hit rating is {hitrating} and dodge rating is {dodgerating}. (Both can be increased by relevant adjustment rates).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Critical Hit Rate
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines the chance of dealing critical damage or heal.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Vitality
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines max health points, current max health points is {rate}.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Critical Damage
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Determines critical hit damage/heal.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Physical Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against physical damage. Reduces {rate}% physical damage done by lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Fire Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against fire damage. Reduces {rate}% fire damage done by lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Shadow Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against shadow damage. Reduces {rate}% shadow damage done by lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Ice Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against ice damage. Reduces {rate}% ice damage done by lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Poison Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against poison damage. Reduces {rate}% poison damage done by lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Divine Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against divine damage. Reduces {rate}% divine damage done by lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Lightning Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against lightning damage. Reduces {rate}% lightning damage done by lv. {level} enemies (reduction rate is increased for lower level enemies, and is decreased for higher level enemies).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: All Elemental Resistance
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Defense against all elemental damage, check individual elemental resistance for details

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Life on Hit
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Rate of heal per damage dealt, up to 20% of wearer's total health points.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Taunt on Hit
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Chance of taunting target per hit for 3 seconds

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Stun on Hit
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Chance of stunning target for 2 seconds on hit

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Damage Reflection
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of damage to be reflected back to attacker. Damage values used for reflection calculation are raw damage (no resistance reductions), and reflected damage is of type Real Damage.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Battle Recovery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Heal rate at the start of each battle.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Turn Recovery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Heal rate each turn.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Mining Mastery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases the amount of ores dropped from enemies.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Logging Mastery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases the amount of timbers dropped from enemies.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Hunting Mastery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases the amount of hides dropped from enemies.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Heal Effectivenesss
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases heal received.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Fire Damage Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases fire damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Physical Damage Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases physical damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Resilience
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Decreases critical damage received

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Damage Reduction
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Further reduces all damage taken after resistance calculations

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Ice Damage Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases ice damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Shadow Damage Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases shadow damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Poison Damage Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases poison damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Divine Damage Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases divine damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Lightning Damage Enhancement
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases lightning damage done from all sources: skills, tactics, items, effects, etc.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Rage Efficiency
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Decreases tactic rage cost, up to 80%.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Heal Absorption
AttributeLocalizations.Description: The portion of direct heal gets converted into damage absorption shield, up to adventurer's maximum health points.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Effect Mastery
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases lasting time of all positive and negative effects from skills, tactic and items.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Hit Rate Adjustment
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases percentage of agility participating in Hit Rate Calculation for enemies that can dodge. Higher values grant higher hit rate.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Dodge Rate Adjustment
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Enables dodge and increases percentage of agility participating in Hit Rate Calculation. Higher values grant higher dodge rate.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Effect Hit Rating
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Reduces enemies' chance of resisting caster's negative effects. Useful on higher level enemies (lv.80+).

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Effect Resistance Rating
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Increases chances of resisting negative effects.

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Phyical Penetration
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of Physical Resistance to be ignored when dealing damage

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Fire Penetration
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of Fire Resistance to be ignored when dealing damage

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Ice penetration
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of Ice Resistance to be ignored when dealing damage

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Shadow Penetration
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of Shadow Resistance to be ignored when dealing damage

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Poison Penetration
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of Shadow Resistance to be ignored when dealing damage

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Divine Penetration
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of Divine Resistance to be ignored when dealing damage

AttributeLocalizations.Name: Lightning Penetration
AttributeLocalizations.Description: Percentage of Lightning Resistance to be ignored when dealing damage

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Darkness Revenge
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:
During adventure, all direct damage recevied by adventurers will add one layer of 'Darkness Revenge', deals {damagepersecond}% of final damage per second. 
Whenever 'Darkness Revenge' triggers, {chargerate}% of 'Corrupted Strength' is accumulated, when fully charged, all adventurers' agility will be reduced by {agilityrate}% and rage generation reduced by {ragerate}%. Up to 10 stacks.

 Blood Stone Beast may revive once, and recovers {healrate}% of maximum health. Its skill will be changed to {skill} and cast immediately upon revive.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Demon Skull
SpecialEffectLocalizations.Description:

 Each bleeding trigger charges {chargerate}% of 'Soul Collection', which may grant Demon Skull {agilityboost} agility when fully charged.
Demon skull may revive once, and immediately add {revivelayers} bleeding effects for all adventurers. Moreover, 'Soul Collection' may grant additional {strengthboost} strength.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Corrupted Horn

Worm Nest casts 'Gu' every {chargetime} seconds, stun all adventurers for {stunseconds} seconds, sucking life, equals to {lifedrinkrate}% of Wom Nest's output, out of adventurers. Any divine damage may interrupt 'Gu', and stun Worm Nest for {selfstuns} seconds.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Darkness

Enters Chaotic mode every {chargeseconds} seconds, and can be interrupted by direct divine damage. When not interrupted, 'Inversed Kill' is unleashed after {channeling} seconds, dealing {damagerate}% {damagetype} to a random adventurer.
After revived, Cool Down for Chaotic Mode is reduced to {revivedchargeseconds} seconds.

In addition, damage dealt on Beast of Atonement will be shared 200% to Bloody Eye. When either beasts is killed, 'Strange Ghost' may no longer be effective.

SpecialEffectLocalizations.Name: Divine Blindness

Whenever Demon Dragon grants {stack} 'Heavenly Strength', it deals {explosive}% {damagetype} to all adventurers, and stuns them for {stun} seconds. 
Demon Dragon's power is contrainted in current form, every type of elemental damage can increase all damage it receives by {damageincrease}% for {lasting}seconds.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Upgrade Cards
ManualLocalizations.Description:
The player may level up adventurers by spending practice points. 

Every 3 levels, the player is given the opportunity to pick up an upgrade card for the adventurer.

Upgrade cards can boost adventurer’s attributes, unlock tactics and enable elemental effects.

The player may redraw existing upgrade cards by spending golds. There is no limit on the number of redraws, although with each redraw the cost may increase.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Tactics
ManualLocalizations.Description:
On the first Upgrade Card selection at level 3, a ‘Tactic Unlock’ card may be drawn. Selecting this card enables the adventurer’s tactic. If the player does not choose this card at level 3, it may be drawn in later Upgrade Card draws. Only level 3 guarantees the ‘Tactic Unlock’ card to be drawn.

In battles, the player may use tactics by spending ‘Rage Points’. Each adventurer type has their own unique tactic.

Each tactic also includes a 'tactic aura', a passive effect which is enabled while the player has enough rage points to use the tactic.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Elements and Effect
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Adventurer has his/her own element, e.g. Fire Player’s element is Fire.

Adventurer’s own element forms part of their final damage, although it may not be the only damage element. Skills may incur additional elemental damage, for instance Fire Charger’s skill can deal fire, lightning and caster’s own elemental damage. Additional details can be found in skill description tooltips for each adventurer.

Moreover, adventurer’s equipment may deal additional elemental damage, e.g. item with effect ‘30% chance of dealing 200% ice damage to all enemy units on hit’ may deal ice damage on top of adventurer’s skill/tactic damage.

Adventurer’s primary elemental effect is unlocked at level 15, and other elemental effects are unlocked at level 30. Details of elemental effects can be viewed in Adventurer Panel.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Gems
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Gems can be looted from monsters.

Players may embed gems into adventurers’ equipment, to receive the attribute boosts on the gem as well as activate gem set effects.

The set bonus effect on gems is activate whenever the adventurer has the requisite number of gems listed on the set effect. They will be active so long as the gem has the same name, even if the gems are not all at the same level. 

Players may purchase a 'Socket Patch' to give equipment additional sockets.

Weapons can have 4 sockets, and armors can only have 3 sockets.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Primary Attribute and Output Capacity
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Each adventurer has a primary attribute, e.g. Fashion Boy’s primary attribute is intelligence, Warrior’s primary attribute is strength.

Players may view adventurer’s primary attribute in ‘Adventurer Panel’.

Adventurer’s primary attribute value is determined by their primary attribute. For instance, a Missionary with 100 intelligence has 100 output capacity.

When the term ‘Output Capacity’ is used in skill descriptions, it directly uses this number to determine results, i.e. ‘200% (of caster’s output capacity) fire damage’ means 240 fire damage for a caster with 120 intelligence, before resistances and other modifiers.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Defense and Damage Reduction
ManualLocalizations.Description:
All damage may be reduced by the relevant damage resistance, e.g. 200 physical damage on a target with 1000 physical resistance will result in considerably lower final damage.

In addition to resistances, damage can also be reduced by Resilience whenever the target receives a critical strike.

There are more methods to reduce damage in the game, such as skills or item effects, so be sure to keep an eye out for more!

ManualLocalizations.Name: Invitations and Adventurers
ManualLocalizations.Description:
The Inn is the only place to acquire new adventurers.

Every 20 game days, new adventures may visit the Inn. There is also a chance for a new adventurer to visit the inn upon a successful adventure.

Adventurer's will stay at the inn for 45 days, and will leave afterwards if they are not hired.

At the beginning of the game, the player is given the invitations for the classes Killer, Street Man, Drunk Reader, and Missionary by default. As the player completes more adventures and acquires new invitations, adventurers of new classes may visit the inn!

ManualLocalizations.Name: Adventurer’s Rarity
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Adventurers can be found at the different rarity grades of normal, rare, epic, legendary, and ancient. Adventurers of different grades have different growth potentials, and can even have different growth potentials within the same rarity. 

Rarity determines the potential stat gains on level-ups.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Reputation and Town Titles
ManualLocalizations.Description:
As the player advances towards higher dungeon levels, the reputation of the town also increases, acquiring new titles for the town as a result.

Higher town titles allow applications of town residents with higher contributions, as well as unlocking higher level recipes later in the game.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Residents
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Upon a successful adventure, new resident applications will be available in town hall

Residents may provide various contributions to the town, as well as having various exploration attributes.

As the player advances to higher level dungeons, town reputation increases, and residents with higher contribution stats will apply to live in town.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Exploration
ManualLocalizations.Description:
When the player has acquired town title 'Salvation of Heaven', a new quest 'Exploration' is given. Completing the quest enables the 'Exploration' feature.

The player may send out adventurers and residents for explorations, looting treasures from overseas. While on an exploration, residents continue to give their town contribution, but adventurers cannot be used in battle.

ManualLocalizations.Name: Damage
ManualLocalizations.Description:
Damage can be categorized into Direct Damage and Non-Direct Damage.

Direct Damage is instant damage done by skills, passives and items. Direct Damage is required to trigger different effects. E.g. Poison Element Effect: Direct poison damage causes targets bleed for 3 seconds.

Non-Direct Damage includes Damage-over-Time and reflected damage. Non-Direct Damage cannot trigger effects.

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Tea Party
TownEventLocalizaitons.Description: Attracts 1 adventurer of Supporter role (10-80% increased quality chance boost) to visit the Inn. Increases all resistances for adventurers in battle. Unlocks at 'Dragon's Blessing'.

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Banquet
TownEventLocalizaitons.Description: Attracts 1 adventurer of Assassin role (10-80% increased quality chance boost) to visit the Inn. Increases critical damage for adventurers in battle. Unlocks at 'Dragon's Blessing'.

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Drumming

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Meditation

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Poetry Party
TownEventLocalizaitons.Description: Attracts 2 adventurers (10-80% increased quality chance boost) to visit the Inn. Unlocks at 'Wonderland's whispers'.

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Trade
TownEventLocalizaitons.Description: Enhances trading route, increase all equipment sell price by 50-250% for a period of time. Unlocks at 'Fairy's crooning'.

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Alchemy
TownEventLocalizaitons.Description: Makes 1-3 mystic potions, and increases output capacity for adventurers in battle. Unlocks at 'Wonderland's whispers'.

TownEventLocalizaitons.Name: Armory Research
TownEventLocalizaitons.Description: Enhances all crafting facilities, allows the next 3-12 ancient items produced by factories or furnace to have 2 extra properties. Unlocks at 'Wonderful future'.
